sanavesa.net

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • sanavesa.net.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    The Server class is the backend foundation for the server. It contains all the network functionality with clients such as accepting new connections, sending, and receiving new data. The Server class is the back-end foundation for the client-server architecture. It contains the essential features required to represent a server. To fully utilize this class' capabilities, it is preferable to extend the class to fine-tune the server. The data transmission for each connected client is handled by the NetworkCommunication class. Also, each client has its own thread for network data transmission.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    NetworkCommunication, ServerClient

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server()
        Constructs a new Server instance. The constructor sets up the shutdown hook for when the server is terminated unexpectedly by disconnecting all clients from the server. It will terminate all server connections and stop the listening thread.
        Since:
        1.1

      • onReceivedData

        final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void onReceivedData(T data,
                                                          ServerClient sender)
        This method is triggered automatically when the server has received data from any client. The data received is a class that implements the NetworkSerializable interface. The data received is handled by the interface via the NetworkSerializable.handleOnServer(Server, ServerClient) method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data received
        Parameters:
        data - - the data object received
        sender - - the sender of the data
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        NetworkSerializable, ServerClient

      • onServerFailedToStart

        protected void onServerFailedToStart(int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the server has failed to start running startServer(int) method.
        Parameters:
        port - - the attempted port of the server
        Since:
        1.0

      • onServerStarted

        protected void onServerStarted(int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the server has successfully started running via the startServer(int) method.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port of the server that started
        Since:
        1.0

      • onServerStopped

        protected void onServerStopped(int port)
        This method is triggered automatically when the server has stopped running via the stopServer() method.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port of the server that stopped
        Since:
        1.0

      • resetInstance

        private final void resetInstance()
        Used internally to reset the instance's variables. It will terminate all server connections and stop the listening thread.
        Since:
        1.0

      • run

        final void run()
        The run method handles the new client connections. This method should never be explicitly called as it automatically handled by the ServerThread class, which calls this method on a separate thread. Incoming data will trigger the onReceivedData(NetworkSerializable, ServerClient) method, where the user is able to override and handle the data as he or she wishes.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ClientThread

      • sendDataTo

        public final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void sendDataTo(T data,
                                                             ServerClient recipient)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                             java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sends the specified data object to the specified client.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data to send
        Parameters:
        data - - the data to send to the specified client
        recipient - - the client who we want to send to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - thrown when data or recipient is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - thrown when recipient is not connected
        Since:
        1.0

      • sendDataToAll

        public final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void sendDataToAll(T data)
                                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sends the specified data object to all connected clients.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data to send
        Parameters:
        data - - the data to send to all connected clients
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - thrown when data is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - thrown when any supposedly connected ServerClient instance is not connected
        Since:
        1.0

      • sendDataToMatch

        public final <T extends NetworkSerializable> void sendDataToMatch(T data,
                                                                  java.util.function.Predicate<ServerClient> predicate)
                                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                  java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sends the specified data object to the specified clients that are identified by the predicate. All clients that match the condition specified in the predicate will get the data.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - the class type of the data to send
        Parameters:
        data - - the data object to send
        predicate - - a predicate that defines which clients receive the packet
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - thrown when data or predicate is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - - thrown when any supposedly connected ServerClient instance that matches the condition in the predicate is not connected
        Since:
        1.0

      • startServer

        public final void startServer(int port)
        Attempts to start the server. If the server is already running on any port, then this method will terminate early and do nothing. The following methods will get triggered:
        • onServerStarted(int) - if the server started successfully
        • onServerFailedToStart(int) - if the server failed to start, most likely that the port is already in use
        Parameters:
        port - - the port to run the server on
        Since:
        1.0

      • stopServer

        public final void stopServer()
        Stops the server from running, which terminates all connections. Attempts to start the server. If the server is not running, then this method will terminate early and do nothing. The method onServerStopped(int) will be triggered.
        Since:
        1.0

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a nicely formatted string representation of the server object along with its connection status and number of connected clients.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string of the server object
        Since:
        1.1
